nexttext:
where the incoming proton interacts via its charm constituents described by the parton distribution function (PDF) $c(x_a,Q^2)$. Here, $f(x_t,Q^2)$ is the PDF of the target, $x_a$ is the active charm quark fractional momentum, $x_t$ is the target parton fractional momentum and $\hat{\sigma}_{f \,\bar{c} \rightarrow f \,\bar{c}}$ is the partonic cross section. We sum over the diagrams involving a charm constituent of the interacting hadrons shown in Fig. \ref{fig:feyn}. All subprocesses are explicitly given in the appendix. We fix the two free parameters, $Q^2$ and $\hat{t}_{min}$, to $3~m_c^2$ and $2~m_c^2$, respectively, to match $c \bar{c}$ cross section data following references~\cite{Alice:2012,ATLAS:2011fea,Aaij:2013mga,Adare:2006hc,Adamczyk:2012af}. Whereas the charm structure function of the proton could at best be guessed at in reference~\cite{Halzen:Diff}, the charm partonic distribution function has now been determined by collider experiments. For this paper, we use the PDF set CT10 \cite{Lai:2010vv}.

We next focus on the contribution of the charm cross section where the spectator quark bleaches its color by combining with the valence quarks in the incident proton,
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\frac{\partial\sigma(pp\rightarrow\bar{c}_{a})}{\partial x_{a}}=\sum_{f}\int\,%
dx_{t}\,c(x_{a},Q^{2})\,f(x_{t},Q^{2})\,\hat{\sigma}_{f\,\bar{c}\rightarrow f%
\,\bar{c}}," display="block"><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mi>σ</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>p</mi><mi>p</mi><mo>→</mo><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover><mi>a</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>a</mi></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><munder><mo largeop="true" movablelimits="false" symmetric="true">∑</mo><mi>f</mi></munder><mrow><mo largeop="true" rspace="4.2pt" symmetric="true">∫</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>𝑑</mo><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>t</mi></msub></mpadded></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>a</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo rspace="4.2pt" stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>f</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>t</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>Q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo rspace="4.2pt" stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>σ</mi><mo stretchy="false">^</mo></mover><mrow><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>f</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover></mrow><mo>→</mo><mrow><mpadded width="+1.7pt"><mi>f</mi></mpadded><mo>⁢</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">¯</mo></mover></mrow></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext: where $x_s$ is the spectator charm quark fractional momentum and $x_{u1}, x_{u2}, x_d$ are the valence quarks fractional momenta. We enforce $x_s = 1 - x_a - x_{u_1} - x_{u_2} - x_d$ such that the spectator charm quark carries all momentum not carried by the valence quarks or active charm quark. Finally, $P(x_{u_1},x_{u_2},x_d)$ is the probability distribution of the valence quarks fractional momentums given by the normalized parton distribution functions of the valence quarks,
prevtext:
where the incoming proton interacts via its charm constituents described by the parton distribution function (PDF) $c(x_a,Q^2)$. Here, $f(x_t,Q^2)$ is the PDF of the target, $x_a$ is the active charm quark fractional momentum, $x_t$ is the target parton fractional momentum and $\hat{\sigma}_{f \,\bar{c} \rightarrow f \,\bar{c}}$ is the partonic cross section. We sum over the diagrams involving a charm constituent of the interacting hadrons shown in Fig. \ref{fig:feyn}. All subprocesses are explicitly given in the appendix. We fix the two free parameters, $Q^2$ and $\hat{t}_{min}$, to $3~m_c^2$ and $2~m_c^2$, respectively, to match $c \bar{c}$ cross section data following references~\cite{Alice:2012,ATLAS:2011fea,Aaij:2013mga,Adare:2006hc,Adamczyk:2012af}. Whereas the charm structure function of the proton could at best be guessed at in reference~\cite{Halzen:Diff}, the charm partonic distribution function has now been determined by collider experiments. For this paper, we use the PDF set CT10 \cite{Lai:2010vv}.

We next focus on the contribution of the charm cross section where the spectator quark bleaches its color by combining with the valence quarks in the incident proton,

{2}}-x_{d})\bigg{]}," display="inline"><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><msub><mi>u</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><msub><mi>u</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>d</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mi>δ</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>s</mi></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>a</mi></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><msub><mi>u</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><msub><mi>u</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>d</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo maxsize="210%" minsize="210%">]</mo><mo>,</mo></mrow></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E6X.m2" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\displaystyle\hat{\sigma}(gg\rightarrow c\bar{c})=\frac{\sigma_{0}}{4}\bigg{[}%
